source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk1
evidence_span: Controlled composition Zircaloy-2 is defined where nickel and iron are adjusted towards the upper ASTM composition limits and tin is adjusted towards the lower limit
composition_raw: nickel and iron at upper ASTM limits, tin at lower limit, chromium at mid-range
process_step: hot rolled, cold rolled, intermediate anneals, final anneal

extra_properties.hydrogen_uptake: depended primarily on corrosion weight gains

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk1
evidence_span: Process A material was hot rolled at 640°C and each of the cold reductions was followed by a short intermediate anneal of 566°C
composition_raw: nickel and iron at upper ASTM limits, tin at lower limit, chromium at mid-range
process_step: hot rolled at 640°C, cold rolled, intermediate anneals at 566°C

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk1
evidence_span: Process B and C material were hot rolled at 730°C. Intermediate anneals at 730°C were employed for Process B material, while 566°C intermediate anneals were used for Process C material
composition_raw: nickel and iron at upper ASTM limits, tin at lower limit, chromium at mid-range
process_step: hot rolled at 730°C, cold rolled, intermediate anneals at 730°C or 566°C

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk2
evidence_span: Two 680 mm diameter by 8200 kg triple melt ingots were melted. The ingots were forged to a slab thickness of 90 to 115 mm and beta-quenched...
process_step: triple melt → forged → beta-quenched → hot rolled → cold rolled → intermediate anneals → final continuous anneal

extra_properties.annealing_parameter_effect: increases post-transition rate and weight gain

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk2
evidence_span: A final test series was run using controlled composition Zircaloy-2 strip and nominal composition Zircaloy-4 strip...
process_step: beta-quenched → hot rolled at 650°C → cold rolled twice → intermediate and final anneals at 640°C for 6 min

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: Corrosion results for 0.7–mm controlled composition Zircaloy-2 strip manufactured with full-scale production equipment are shown in Table 3

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk3
evidence_span: Corrosion results for 2-mm-thick controlled composition Zircaloy-2, beta-quenched at 90-mm thickness

evidence_span: Production Zircaloy-2 2-mm strip results (90-mm beta-quenched slab)

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: In the $3 6 0 \mathrm { { \circ C } }$ water test, the corrosion weight gains decrease by $1 5 \%$ as nickel increases from 580 to $7 5 0 ~ \mathrm { p p m }$

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: In the $4 2 0 \mathrm { { ‰} }$ test the effect of nickel is to decrease the variability in weight gains that occurs due to different processing conditions

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: In the $3 6 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C }$ tests, the influence of increasing nickel is to decrease the post-transition rates by about $10 \%$

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: The B process coupons generally have the highest $3 6 0 \mathrm { { ^ \circ C } }$ weight gains at 588 days

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: The A and $\mathbf { C }$ process coupons have about the same final weight gain at 588 days

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: The B process used full recrystallization intermediate anneals versus recovery intermediate anneals for the A and C processes
process_step: B process: full recrystallization intermediate anneals; A and C processes: recovery intermediate anneals

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: X-ray diffraction studies of the current material showed the lower weight gain A and C lot materials to have $f _ { \mathrm { v } } = 0 . 7 3$ . while the B lot material had $f _ { N }$ $= 0 . 3 8$

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: In the $4 2 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ test the $1 . 3 ~ \mathrm { m m }$ thick coupons performed better as a group than did the 0.7 mm thick coupons
corrosion_data: 1.3 mm coupons performed better than 0.7 mm coupons

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: The A and C processed $1 . 3 ~ \mathsf { m m }$ thick coupons had a stressrelief anneal $( 5 6 6 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } )$ , while the B processed $1 . 3 ~ \mathrm { m m }$ thick coupon had a full recrystallization anneal $( 7 3 0 ^ { \circ } \mathrm { C } )$
process_step: A and C: stress-relief anneal; B: full recrystallization anneal

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk5
evidence_span: The $0 . 7 ~ \mathrm { m m }$ specimens in the $4 2 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ test had similar trends to their counterparts in the $3 6 0 \mathrm { { } ^ { \circ } C }$ test

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk6
evidence_span: high annealing parameter data point, ΣA_i = 18 × 10^{-19} h
composition_raw: nickel and iron adjusted towards upper ASTM B 350 limits, tin towards lower limit
process_step: beta-quenched, extruded to tubeshell, hot and cold rolled to sheet
corrosion_data: weight gain with orientation effect discount

extra_properties.texture_effect: high fraction of basal poles oriented in sheet normal direction provides lowest weight gains

source_id: STP1132-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_9th Volume_020_chunk6
evidence_span: post-transition rate climbs from about 0.28 mdd to 0.36 mdd
corrosion_data: 0.28-0.36 mdd post-transition rate, 190 mg/dm² acceleration point, 318 mg/dm² at 1000 days
